pageContext.claim: “We have among the lowest case-fatality rates -- our country -- anywhere in the world, the entire world. And we performed significantly better than our peer countries.”
pageContext.analysis: Since Trump first made this claim in July, the U.S. case fatality has certainly improved -- among the 20 countries most affected by COVID-19 worldwide, according to Johns Hopkins University. That's not a great peer group, but the U.S. had improved its position to 5th best in case-mortality rate. But the U.S. still ranks fourth in deaths per thousand population.
